newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanese University teachers on one-day strike.
newsitem.headline: Lebanese University teachers on one-day strike.

text.p: Some 1,600 lecturers at state-run Lebanese University staged a one-day strike on Thursday for the fourth time in 1997 to protest against the government's ignoring of their long-standing demands.
The demands include full independence of the university, full tenure for contract staff and a new pay scale.
"Our main demand today is the free the university of all forms of political interference," Khaled Hdadeh, member of the executive committee of the university teachers told Reuters.
The strike idled 45,000 students at the state-run university. It did not affect private institutions.
